entry.title: Curtailed but Ambitious: Russia‚Äôs Role in the South Caucasus- Pavel Baev

media:group.media:title: Curtailed but Ambitious: Russia‚Äôs Role in the South Caucasus- Pavel Baev
media:group.media:description:
Pavel Baev is a political scientist and security expert specializing in Russian military affairs and Eurasian security at the Peace Research Institute Oslo (PRIO). He delivered a speech titled ‚ÄòCurtailed but Ambitious: Russia‚Äôs Role in the South Caucasus‚Äô during the conference ‚ÄúGathering Storm: Regional Security in the South Caucasus Amid the Global Order Crisis‚Äú organized by the Caucasus Institute in Yerevan on March 21, 2025.

entry.title: Armenia seeks major gas deal with Turkmenistan: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia seeks major gas deal with Turkmenistan: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia is in talks with Turkmenistan on a multibillion-dollar natural gas deal, a senior advisor to Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan has revealed. That could lessen the country‚Äôs dependence on Russia, which supplies the vast majority of Armenia‚Äôs gas. üìç A senior Russian official again warned Armenia that the country may have to choose between staying in the Eurasian Economic Union and joining the European Union. Leaving the Kremlin-led bloc would have broad economic impacts for Armenia. üìç Elon Musk‚Äôs Starlink satellite internet system is now online in Armenia, government and company representatives confirmed.

media:group.media:title: Starlink launches in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç Starlink satellite internet services, provided by the SpaceX company, are now available in Armenia, the country‚Äôs Minister of High-Tech Industry Mkhitar Hayrapetyan announced. üìç The Armenian government will significantly reduce financial assistance for displaced people from Nagorno-Karabakh starting April 1, raising concerns for thousands of families who fled following Azerbaijan's 2023 offensive and ethnic cleansing of the region. üìç Armenia lags behind global decline in smoking rates: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/825110/armenia-lags-behind-global-decline-in-smoking-rates/

entry.title: The Wider Black Sea Region: A Romanian Perspective- Gheorghe Magheru

media:group.media:title: The Wider Black Sea Region: A Romanian Perspective- Gheorghe Magheru
media:group.media:description:
In a speech titled ‚ÄòThe Wider Black Sea Region in the Context of the Global Crisis‚Äô, veteran Romanian diplomat and former Ambassador to the Council of Europe Gheorghe Magheru discusses what can be learned about state-building in the South Caucasus from the experiences of the other countries in the wider Black Sea region. Magheru delivered his talk at the conference "Gathering Storm: Regional Security in the South Caucasus Amid the Global Order Crisis" organized by the Caucasus Institute in Yerevan on March 21, 2025.

What security challenges is the South Caucasus facing and expected to face in the context of a global order crisis? The issue brought together leading experts and scholars from Armenia, Georgia, Turkey, Azerbaijan, and beyond onto a single platform.
The international conference was organized by the Caucasus Institute within the framework of the project ‚ÄúEngaging Society and Government in Armenia in Developing an Agenda for a Secure Region,‚Äù funded by the UK International Development from the UK government.
Held on March 21, the conference was titled ‚ÄúGATHERING STORM: REGIONAL SECURITY OF THE SOUTH CAUCASUS IN THE CONTEXT OF THE CRISIS OF THE GLOBAL ORDER.

entry.title: Arrests, intimidation of opposition candidates ahead of Gyumri election

media:group.media:title: Arrests, intimidation of opposition candidates ahead of Gyumri election
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan escalates his long-standing feud with the country‚Äôs three former presidents with another live debate challenge. üìç Opposition alliances sound the alarm in Gyumri following office raids and arrests of members ahead of a tight municipal election this weekend. üìç CivilNet spoke to border residents who have recently been hearing shots from Azerbaijani side. They say they feel safer with the EU monitors there, a group Baku demands be removed. üìç Turkish and Armenian consuls in Aleppo, Syria meet in a rare diplomatic exchange between the two nations.

entry.title: Turning the tables on Baku‚Äôs information warfare

media:group.media:title: Turning the tables on Baku‚Äôs information warfare
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, Eric Hacopian focuses on the issue of disinformation by Baku and the need for Armenians to be more critical before spreading such news. He gives recent examples of how Azerbaijan tries to control the narrative by purchasing articles in legitimate-sounding outlets and names one of the questionable characters who assists the process. He encourages Armenians to adopt a skeptical lens for all news coming from their country‚Äôs enemies, and to go on the media offensive instead of merely reacting to dubious stories.
